s.text: Back to the book: Other publications give it a warm response--Joan Jacobs Brumberg writes in the Washington Post that Angier "eviscerates two ...
The sound is equal parts glam, punk, and metal, and features Cheap Trick guitarist Rick Nielsen.

Entertainment Weekly 's Lisa Schwarzbaum calls the film "blithe and exhilarating," and Time 's Richard Schickel calls it "utterly charming--and very smart."

old saws: that hard science must be boring and that feminists have no sense of humor."
Also, the Times ' Sunday book review section killed a second review of the book, a negative one by theorist Helena Cronin.

An overtly negative review in the New York Times Book Review , by Courtney Weaver, calls the tone "self-consciously humorous"; says the wit at times "disintegrates into cutesy one-liners"; and complains that the stories are plagued by a "certain generic weariness."
After killing Cronin's review, the Sunday Times ran a gushing review of the book ("it is a tour de force, a wonderful, entertaining and informative book"--Abraham Verghese).
Book Review Editor Charles McGrath defended delivering the spike to Cronin's piece: "I didn't like the tone of the review--I thought it was too snarky.
